title: Barton's Point Coastal Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Peter Lelliott / Barton's Point Coastal Park
images.caption: Barton's Point Coastal Park. Canal view near the coastal end of the park

images.title: Penny Mayes, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: There was a battery here, completed in 1890, and the associated basin, connecting with Queenborough Lines, is now used as a boating lake. The ditches were presumably to help drain this rather marshy land.

images.title: PAUL FARMER / View across lake at Barton's Point Coastal Park
images.caption: View across the lake

images.title: Peter Lelliott / Swans at Barton's Point Coastal Park
images.caption: Swans on the lake in the park

description: Enjoy a leisurely stroll or ride along the Queenborough Lines canal and the Isle of Sheppey Coast on this circular route in Bartons Point Coastal Park. The route begins on the coast near Sheerness train station and follows the canal path before returning to the start point through Minster Park. In the park there's a pretty lake with birdlife and nice trails along the beach.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Sheerness Way runs past the park. This circular shared cycling and walking route is a good way to extend your exercise in the area. Leysdown Coastal Park is also just to the south and worth a visit.

display_address: Marine Parade, Merryman's Hill, Minster-on-Sea, Minster, Swale, Kent, England, ME12 2FD, United Kingdom
